item.name: ClassLoading - Loaded Class Count
item.description: The number of classes currently loaded in the VM

item.name: ClassLoading - Total Loaded Class Count
item.description: The total number of classes loaded since the start of the VM

item.name: ClassLoading - Unloaded Class Count
item.description: The total number of classes unloaded since the start of the VM

item.name: Compilation - Accumulated Time Spent in Compilation
item.description: The approximate accumulated elapsed time spent in compilation the amount of time spent in just-in-time (JIT) compilation

item.name: GarbageCollector - ConcurrentMarkSweep number of collections per second
GarbageCollector - ConcurrentMarkSweep accumulated time spent in collection
GarbageCollector - Copy number of collections per second
GarbageCollector - Copy accumulated time spent in collection
GarbageCollector - MarkSweepCompact number of collections per second
GarbageCollector - MarkSweepCompact accumulated time spent in collection
GarbageCollector - ParNew number of collections per second
GarbageCollector - ParNew accumulated time spent in collection
GarbageCollector - PS MarkSweep number of collections per second
GarbageCollector - PS MarkSweep accumulated time spent in collection
GarbageCollector - PS Scavenge number of collections per second
GarbageCollector - PS Scavenge accumulated time spent in collection
Memory - Heap Memory Committed
item.description: Current heap memory allocated. This amount of memory is guaranteed for the Java virtual machine to use

item.name: Memory - Heap Memory Max
item.description: Maximum amount of heap that can be used for memory management. This amount of memory is not guaranteed to be available if it is greater than the amount of committed memory. The Java virtual machine may fail to allocate memory even if the amount of used memory does not exceed this maximum size.

item.name: Memory - Non-Heap Memory Committed
item.description: Current memory allocated outside the heap. This amount of memory is guaranteed for the Java virtual machine to use

item.name: Memory - Non-Heap Memory Max
item.description: Maximum amount of non-heap memory that can be used for memory management. This amount of memory is not guaranteed to be available if it is greater than the amount of committed memory. The Java virtual machine may fail to allocate memory even if the amount of used memory does not exceed this maximum size.

item.name: Memory - Non-Heap Memory Used
item.description: Current memory usage outside the heap

item.name: Memory - Object Pending Finalization Count
item.description: The approximate number of objects for which finalization is pending

item.name: Runtime - Uptime
item.description: how long the JVM has been running

item.name: Threading - Deamon Thread Count
item.description: Count of threads marked as daemons in the system

item.name: Threading - Peak Thread Count
item.description: Peak count of active threads in the system

item.name: Threading - Thread Count
item.description: Number of active threads in the system

item.name: Threading - Total Started Thread Count
item.description: Count of threads started since system start

resource.name: JMX - Memory Pool CMS Old Gen
JMX - Garbage Collector collections per second

trigger.name: [{HOST.NAME}] 80% OperatingSystem Opened File Descriptor Count used
[{HOST.NAME}] 80% OperatingSystem Process CPU Load
trigger.description: Returns the "recent cpu usage" for the Java Virtual Machine process.

trigger.expression: {Template JMX Generic - Extended:jmx["java.lang:type=MemoryPool,name=CMS Old Gen",Usage.used].last(0)}>({Template JMX Generic - Extended:jmx["java.lang:type=MemoryPool,name=CMS Old Gen",Usage.max].last(0)}*0.9)
trigger.name: [{HOST.NAME}] 90% MemoryPool CMS Old Gen used

trigger.expression: {Template JMX Generic - Extended:jmx["java.lang:type=MemoryPool,name=Code Cache",Usage.used].last(0)}>({Template JMX Generic - Extended:jmx["java.lang:type=MemoryPool,name=Code Cache",Usage.max].last(0)}*0.9)
trigger.name: [{HOST.NAME}] 90% MemoryPool Code Cache used

trigger.expression: {Template JMX Generic - Extended:jmx["java.lang:type=Memory",NonHeapMemoryUsage.max].last(0)} > 0 and {Template JMX Generic - Extended:jmx["java.lang:type=Memory",NonHeapMemoryUsage.used].last(0)} > ({Template JMX Generic - Extended:jmx["java.lang:type=Memory",NonHeapMemoryUsage.max].last(0)}*0.9)
trigger.name: [{HOST.NAME}] 90% Non-Heap Memory used
[{HOST.NAME}] GarbageCollector - Concurrent Mark Sweep in fire fighting mode
trigger.description: More expensive GC algorithm more often than the lesser expensive one, which usually seems to indicate that you should assign more memory to the JVM it is talking about.

trigger.name: [{HOST.NAME}] GarbageCollector - Mark Sweep Compact in fire fighting mode
trigger.description: More expensive GC algorithm more often than the lesser expensive one, which usually seems to indicate that you should assign more memory to the JVM it is talking about.

trigger.name: [{HOST.NAME}] GarbageCollector - PS Mark Sweep in fire fighting mode
trigger.description: More expensive GC algorithm more often than the lesser expensive one, which usually seems to indicate that you should assign more memory to the JVM it is talking about.

trigger.expression: {Template JMX Generic - Extended:jmx["java.lang:type=MemoryPool,name=CMS Old Gen",Usage.committed].last(0)}={Template JMX Generic - Extended:jmx["java.lang:type=MemoryPool,name=CMS Old Gen",Usage.max].last(0)}
trigger.name: [{HOST.NAME}] MemoryPool - CMS Old Gen fully committed

graph.name: JMX - Garbage Collector collections per second
JMX - Memory Pool CMS Old Gen
